channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: Venezuela approves amnesty that may release of hundreds detained for political reasons
item.description: Venezuela's acting president has signed into law an amnesty bill that could lead to the release of politicians, activists, lawyers and many others. The approval marks a stark turn for the nation.
item.content:encoded:
Venezuela's acting president has signed into law an amnesty bill that could lead to the release of politicians, activists, lawyers and many others. The approval marks a stark turn for the nation.

(Image credit: Ariana Cubillos)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: In a historic vote, Tennessee Volkswagen workers get their first union contract
item.description: Two years ago, the successful union drive at this plant was expected to spark victories throughout the South. But now, as members vote to make their contract official, momentum has fizzled.
item.content:encoded:
Two years ago, the successful union drive at this plant was expected to spark victories throughout the South. But now, as members vote to make their contract official, momentum has fizzled.

(Image credit: Stephan Bisaha)
item.dc:creator: Stephan Bisaha

item.title: NASA chief blasts Boeing, space agency for failed Starliner astronaut mission
item.description: NASA's Jared Isaacman slammed Boeing for failures with its Starliner spacecraft, which was deemed unsafe to return its crew of two astronauts from the International Space Station
item.content:encoded:
NASA's Jared Isaacman slammed Boeing for failures with its Starliner spacecraft, which was deemed unsafe to return its crew of two astronauts from the International Space Station

(Image credit: NASA)
item.dc:creator: Brendan Byrne

item.title: U.S. figure skater Alysa Liu said she didn't care if she medaled. She won gold
item.description: Liu is the first American woman to win an individual figure skating gold medal since Sarah Hughes in 2002.
item.content:encoded:
Liu is the first American woman to win an individual figure skating gold medal since Sarah Hughes in 2002.

(Image credit: Jamie Squire)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Internal memo details cosmetic changes and facility repairs to Kennedy Center
item.description: Trump announced his plans to close the Kennedy Center entirely for two years "for Construction, Revitalization, and Complete Rebuilding." The announcement came after many prominent artists canceled existing scheduled appearances.
item.content:encoded:
Trump announced his plans to close the Kennedy Center entirely for two years "for Construction, Revitalization, and Complete Rebuilding." The announcement came after many prominent artists canceled existing scheduled appearances.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: R&B stars consider two ways to serve an audience
item.description: Two albums released the same day — Jill Scott's return from a long absence, and Brent Faiyaz's play for a mid-career pivot — offer opposing visions of artistic advancement in the genre.
item.content:encoded:
To Whom This May Concern is is the neo-soul veteran's first studio album in a decade.'/>

Two albums released the same day — Jill Scott's return from a long absence, and Brent Faiyaz's play for a mid-career pivot — offer opposing visions of artistic advancement in the genre.

(Image credit: Kennedi Carter)
item.dc:creator: Sheldon Pearce

item.title: Baby chicks link certain sounds with shapes, just like humans do
item.description: A surprising new study shows that baby chickens react the same way that humans do when tested for something called the "bouba-kiki effect," which has been linked to the emergence of language.
item.content:encoded:
A surprising new study shows that baby chickens react the same way that humans do when tested for something called the "bouba-kiki effect," which has been linked to the emergence of language.

(Image credit: Elena Goncharova)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: American Jordan Stolz speedskates to a third Olympic medal -- silver this time
item.description: U.S. speedskater Jordan Stolz had a lot of hype accompanying him in these Winter Olympic Games. He's now got two gold medals, one silver, with one event to go.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. speedskater Jordan Stolz had a lot of hype accompanying him in these Winter Olympic Games. He's now got two gold medals, one silver, with one event to go.

(Image credit: Daniel Munoz)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Bad Bunny and J. Cole rule the pop charts
item.description: These days, the Super Bowl halftime show is a massive driver of the streaming, airplay and sales that fuel the Billboard charts. This week, Bad Bunny benefits from that influence.
item.content:encoded: These days, the Super Bowl halftime show is a massive driver of the streaming, airplay and sales that fuel the Billboard charts. This week, Bad Bunny benefits from that influence.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Thompson

item.title: Reporter's notebook: My Olympic Lunar New Year
item.description: An NPR reporter covering the Olympics in Milan takes us on cultural side quests, to a hospitality house and a candy store.
item.content:encoded:
An NPR reporter covering the Olympics in Milan takes us on cultural side quests, to a hospitality house and a candy store.

(Image credit: Rachel Treisman)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman
